author: Alexandra Rucki
title: Section of M56 will close while new dual carriageway is built - Manchester Evening News

organizations.name: manchester evening news section of m56

text:
Section of M56 will close while new dual carriageway is built The motorway will be shut while a new dual carriageway is created linking Knutsford and Bowdon Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now New dual carriageway between Knutsford and Bowdon Share this video Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Drivers are being warned a section of the M56 will be closed next weekend while a new dual carriageway is completed. 
The motorway will be shut between junctions seven and eight near Altrincham , as well as junction 19 with the M6 in Cheshire. 
Highways England is replacing the A556 between the two motorways with a new dual carriageway between Knutsford and Bowdon . The £192m project is expected to be open for the first time on Monday, March 6. 
Transport chiefs will be closing the A556 and associated motorway junctions from 9pm on Friday, February 17, until 5am the following Monday morning. The new slip road will slash journey times 
It will close again at 9pm on Friday, March 3, until 5am on Monday, March 6, when the new road is expected to open for the first time. Read More 
The old and new A556 will then close once more from 9pm on Friday, March 10, until 5am on Monday, March 13. 
The closure could affect some drivers travelling to Manchester Airport . Drivers will benefit from improved journeys as Highways England reaches a major milestone in the delivery of the new A556 Knutsford to Bowdon link road 
Highways England project manager, Paul Hampson, said: “We’re delighted to be able to confirm that we can start work next week on preparations to open the new road with the first of these three scheduled weekend closures. 
“We appreciate there will be some inconvenience for people wanting to use the A556 and the two motorway junctions over these weekends but we have worked hard to plan diversions for through traffic and local road users, which will be clearly signed. 
“We’re working to publicise these but road users can help by taking a little bit of extra care in planning journeys, especially if they are heading to Manchester Airport on any of the three weekends.” Read More
